About

Blog

04 Aug 2015 . tech . NSTableView automatically adjust height to fit cell view Comments

Reference: Using auto-layout to calculate table cell height In ‘Using auto-layout to calculate table cell height’, it’s introduced how to use auto-layout to update table view’s (UITableView) cell height with Objective-C language. However there is different at NSTableView. Here I will introduce to do similar thing at NSTableView with Swift language. Remember one thing post ‘Using auto-layout to calculate table cell height’ has warned that this method is not that efficient, figure out the way make it more efficient yourself. Assuming you have been familiar with the mechanism of NSTableView, including NSTableViewDelegate and NSTableViewDataSource, I will not introduce these knowledge in detail below. When configure table cell view, it’s helpful later if you seperate some configure functions. func tableView(tableView: NSTableView, viewForTableColumn tableColumn: NSTableColumn?, row:…
